data.title: Amazon Tests Yet Another Brick-and-Mortar Format
data.text: The retailer is trying a low-tech idea.

data.title: Amazon, Microsoft and Facebook advise employees to work from home
data.text: Announcements made following coronavirus guidance from Washington state officials instructing workplaces to allow employees to work remotely

data.title: Inside ‘Amazon Pop Up’ in Seattle: Tech giant offers themed selection at latest physical retail concept
data.text: Amazon is popping open the doors on its latest brick-and-mortar retail concept Friday in Seattle with the arrival of Amazon Pop Up, a rotating shopping experience where customers can go hands-on with a themed selection of items.

data.title: 9 Stocks to Buy If People Get Stuck at Home
data.text: While the markets generally have reacted with volatility over the coronavirus, some stocks to buy have witnessed a rise in sentiment.

data.title: Bipartisan Bill Would Make Amazon, Digital Retailers Responsible for Counterfeits
data.text: The law would shift responsibility from the seller to the platform.

data.title: Amazon tells Seattle-area employees to work from home as coronavirus spreads
data.text: Amazon told employees in Seattle and Bellevue to work from home if they can through the end of the month.

data.title: Amazon, Facebook ask Seattle employees to work from home over coronavirus fears
data.text: Amazon.com Inc and Facebook Inc on Thursday joined Microsoft Corp  in recommending employees in the Seattle area to work from home after several people in the region were infected with the coronavirus.

data.title: House Lawmakers Demand Amazon, eBay Take Stronger Action Against Stolen And Fake Products
data.text: A group of lawmakers from both major political parties has asked Amazon Inc. and eBay Inc. to take stringent action against non-genuine, unsafe or stolen goods on their platforms.

data.title: Amazon and Facebook ask Seattle employees to work from home after coronavirus cases
data.text: Amazon and Facebook are encouraging their employees in Seattle to stay home after workers for each company tested positive for the novel coronavirus.

data.title: Amazon changes coronavirus plan, tells Seattle area employees to work from home until March 31
data.text: Amazon is now asking all of its Seattle-area employees who can do their jobs from home to do so until the end of March amid an ongoing coronavirus outbreak in the region.
